definition: existing or considered in relation to something else

connected with the belief that people are not free to choose what they are like or how they behave, because these things are decided by their environment and other things over which they have no control
doing something in a good, careful and complete way with no waste of time, money or energy
time, knowledge, ideas, etc. that you put into work, a project, etc. in order to make it succeed; the act of putting something in
the act of putting information into a computer; the information that you put in
a place or means for electricity, data, etc. to enter a machine or system
to suggest a plan, an idea, etc. for people to think about and decide on
to intend to do something
to ask somebody to marry you
to suggest something at a formal meeting and ask people to vote on it
to suggest an explanation of something for people to consider
to ask people to wish somebody health, happiness and success by raising their glasses and drinking
a person who is the same age or who has the same social status as you
(in the UK) a member of the nobility or the House of Lords
in a way that is large or important enough to have an effect on something or to be noticed
in a way that has a particular meaning
in a way that has a special or secret meaning
the outline of buildings, trees, hills, etc. seen against the sky
a total number or amount made up of smaller amounts that are collected together
sand or broken stone that is used to make concrete or for building roads, etc.
added together as a total or single amount
when the scores of a number of games are added together
a mixture of different things that are found all together
the process of forming a conglomerate; the state of being a conglomerate
the position of somebody/something on a scale that shows how good or important they are in relation to other similar people or things, especially in sport
an official list showing the best players of a particular sport in order of how successful they are
several different
having many different features
the fact of being careful about what or who you choose
the fact of affecting some things and not others
the process of getting something back, especially from a place where it should not be
the process of getting back information that is stored on a computer
a hollow place or structure that a bird makes or chooses for laying its eggs in and sheltering its young
a place where insects or other small creatures live and produce their young
a secret place which is full of bad people and their activities
the home, thought of as the safe place where parents bring up their children
a group or set of similar things that are made to fit inside each other
to make yourself richer, especially at somebody else's expense, by spending money on yourself that should be spent on somebody/something else
to become able to fly and leave its nest
to leave home and live somewhere else
a difficult situation in which a lot of people get very angry
a discovery that seems interesting but is found to have no value
a very complicated situation
covering a large area; great in amount
including or dealing with a wide range of information
in a way that is connected with or involves scientific experiments
in a way that involves trying new ideas, forms or methods to find out what effect they have
in a way that involves doing something in order to see what happens
to give things to a large number of people; to share something between a number of people
to send goods to shops and businesses so that they can be sold
to spread something, or different parts of something, over an area
a hidden store of things such as weapons
a part of a computer’s memory that stores copies of data that is often needed while a program is running. This data can be accessed very quickly.
to store an image with a fixed number of bits (= units of information) for each unit of the image
the state of relying on somebody/something for something, especially in a way you do not consider right or necessary
a country, an area, etc. that is controlled by another country
the state of being addicted to something (= unable to stop taking or using it)
connected with changing; able to change when necessary in order to deal with different situations
the process of becoming well again after an illness or injury
the process of improving or becoming stronger again
the action or process of getting something back that has been lost or stolen
the room in a hospital where patients are kept immediately after an operation
connected with syntax
detailed information on how to do or use something
something that somebody tells you to do
a piece of information that tells a computer to perform a particular operation
the act of teaching something to somebody
always behaving in the same way, or having the same opinions, standards, etc.
happening in the same way and continuing for a period of time
in agreement with something; not contradicting something
having different parts that all agree with each other
a small wave on the surface of a lake, the sea or the ocean
strong and healthy
strong; able to survive being used a lot and not likely to break
strong and not likely to fail or become weak
strong and determined; showing that you are sure about what you are doing or saying
closely connected with the subject you are discussing or the situation you are in
the fact of being valuable and useful to people in their lives and work
not having everything that it should have; not finished or complete
to press things together or press something into a smaller space; to be pressed in this way
to reduce something and fit it into a smaller space or amount of time
to make computer files, etc. smaller so that they use less space on a disk, etc.
to prove that something is true
to make something legally recognized
to state officially that something is useful and of an acceptable standard
to recognize the value of a person or their feelings or opinions; to make somebody feel valued
in a way that is right or appropriate for a particular purpose or occasion
showing the feelings, etc. that you would expect in a particular situation
in a way that is connected with the ideas and principles on which a particular subject is based, rather than with practice and experiment
in a way that could possibly exist, happen or be true, although this is unlikely
if something is unexpected, it surprises you because you were not expecting it
a summary of a piece of writing, a play, etc.
a sudden very heavy fall of rain
clear; with no clouds
a system of signs or symbols used to represent information, especially in mathematics, science and music
connected with the rules of grammar
correctly following the rules of grammar
the ability to change to suit new conditions or situations
the ability to bend easily without breaking
money or property that is given to you by somebody when they die
a situation that exists now because of events, actions, etc. that took place in the past
the quality of being new, different and interesting
a thing, person or situation that is interesting because it is new, unusual or has not been known before
a small cheap object sold as a toy or a decoration
to succeed in dealing with or controlling a problem that has been preventing you from achieving something
to defeat somebody
to affect somebody very strongly
in a good and careful way, with no waste of time, money or energy
in a way that is accurate or true, without any mistakes
in a way that is right and suitable, so that something is done as it should be done
in a way that follows the accepted standards or rules
to build or make something such as a road, building or machine
to form something by putting different things together
to draw a line or shape according to the rules of mathematics
the quality of always behaving in the same way or of having the same opinions, standard, etc.; the quality of being consistent
the consistency of a mixture or a liquid substance is how thick, smooth, etc. it is
the fact of following the rules or standards of something
needing somebody/something in order to survive or be successful
addicted to something (= unable to stop taking or using it)
affected or decided by something
secondary to another clause, phrase or word
the dried flower of a tropical tree, used in cooking as a spice, especially in sweet foods. Cloves look like small nails.
one of the small separate sections of a bulb (= the round underground part) of garlic
to express the most important parts of something in a few words, a small space or a single object
having, or appearing to have, length, width and depth
material made of a network of wire or plastic threads
the spaces between the individual wires or threads that form a mesh
a complicated situation or system that it is difficult to escape from
that allows information to be passed continuously and in both directions between a computer or other device and the person who uses it
that involves people working together and having an influence on each other
flat; having only two dimensions
having no depth; not seeming like real people
the act of combining separate ideas, beliefs, styles, etc.; a mixture or combination of ideas, beliefs, styles, etc.
the natural chemical production of a substance in animals and plants
the artificial production of a substance that is present naturally in animals and plants
the production of sounds, music or speech by electronic means
accepting in a sensible way what it is actually possible to do or achieve in a particular situation
sensible and appropriate; possible to achieve
representing things as they are in real life
a special bright quality that shows in somebody’s face, for example because they are very happy or healthy
warm light shining from something
a measure of how much light is reflected off a surface, considered as a part of the total light that shines onto it
very strict and difficult to change
not willing to change their ideas or behaviour
stiff and difficult to move or bend
the process or result of changing or damaging the usual or natural shape of something
a change in the usual or natural shape of something
in a way that is connected with a person’s body rather than their mind
according to the laws of nature or what is likely
the use of colour, pencil lines, etc. to give an impression of light and shade in a picture or to emphasize areas of a map, diagram, etc.
slight differences that exist between different aspects of the same thing
a shape that you cannot see clearly, often because it is moving too fast
something that you cannot remember clearly
to calculate something
to make sense
the distance from the top or surface to the bottom of something; a particular distance down from the surface of something
the distance from the front to the back of something
the strength and power of feelings
qualities that give somebody/something extra character and make them/it interesting
the quality of knowing or understanding a lot of details about something; the ability to provide and explain these details
the deepest, most extreme or serious part of something
the strength of a colour
the quality in a work of art or a photograph that makes it appear not to be flat
to be in water that is too deep to stand in with your head above water
to be unable to understand something because it is too difficult; to be in a situation that you cannot control
in a detailed, careful and complete way
to be or to experience an extreme example of something unpleasant
the quality of being strong because you have a great variety of good people, ideas, etc. that can contribute to the success of something
